messages.message:
@Gwen I tried the below prompts with *advanced model* and got the expected responses from the model

`has the physician signed the document? Consider that the physician has signed only when the text '[sign]' is present within the section 'D. Signature of Attending Physician'`

No, the physician has not signed the document as the text '[sign]' is not present.


`has the physician signed the document? Consider that the physician has signed only when the text '[sign]' is present`

 No, the physician has not signed the document as the text '[sign]' is not detected within the section 'D. Signature of Attending Physician'.

`has the physician signed the document? Consider that the physician has signed only when the text '[sign]' is present. Return only Yes or No`

No
Oh interesting!! Let me try to expand my prompt
I tried the files. This is what you see in the text view with a signed form which is the `[SIGN]` tag. So yes the X is detected as `[CHECK]`, but that's independent of if something is signed.
In the form that's not signed, you don't see the `[SIGN]` tag
With Balaram's last prompt in extraction mode in build, i'm able to get the right answer with your docs @Gwen.

Overall I highly recommend using the Extraction mode in Build for extraction related tasks over Reasoning mode. Especially after field type is GA, table extraction should be done with the table field in the Extraction Mode in Build. You can try it out on prod too.
